column8: 6000 mp12s have a really low torque so I am also getting the 2000 rpms just in case these dont have enough torque.

column8: they are 20x42mm and are sillicone high grip wheels.

Notes: This is the microcontroller I am using
column8: it has a lot of pins and is fast enough to handle the sensors and motors.
I am not very familiar with it but it seems to work well with the teensy 4.0 and the motors.

Notes: A 5v buck works well since teensy 4.0 needs 5v to run and outputs the 3v i need for the sensors.
These are known as the best sensors besides the qtrx which are like twice the price. Not too familiar with them
column8: and will have to be careful with them since they are quit expensive.
